description: Accept PayPal and credit card payments online or on mobile.

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: This method is called every time a Paypal webhook event occurs
steps: Use the credentials from your REST API app at https://developer.paypal.com/developer/applications/ as the credentials to get your access token
Go to https://rapidapi.com/package/PayPal/functions/createWebhook and use your access token and the folling URL: __WEBHOOK_URL__

args.name: token
args.info: Token sent on each message

steps: Create an app to receive REST API credentials for testing and live transactions

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Use the OAuth request to get an access token for use with your payments calls.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client id.

args.name: secret
args.info: secret

args.name: grantType
args.info: Token grant type. Must be set to client_credentials.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: createPayment
blocks.description: Use the payment resource for direct credit card payments, stored credit card payments, or PayPal account payments.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: intent
args.info: Payment intent. Must be set to sale for immediate payment, authorize to authorize a payment for capture later, or order to create an order. Allowed values: sale, authorize, order.

args.name: payer
args.info: Json object. Source of the funds for this payment represented by a PayPal account or a direct credit card. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createPayment README for more details.

args.name: transactions
args.info: Array of json objects. Transaction details, if updating a payment. Note that this instance of the transactions object accepts only the amount object. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createPayment README for more details.

args.name: experienceProfileId
args.info: PayPal generated identifier for the merchant's payment experience profile.

args.name: noteToPayer
args.info: free-form field for the use of clients to pass in a message to the payer.

args.name: redirectUrls
args.info: Json object. Set of redirect URLs you provide only for PayPal-based payments. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createPayment README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: executePayment
blocks.description: Executes a PayPal payment that the payer has approved. You can optionally pass in one or more transactions to update transaction information when you execute the payment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: paymentId
args.info: The ID of the payment to execute.

args.name: payerId
args.info: The ID of the payer, passed in the return_url by PayPal.

args.name: transactions
args.info: Transactional details if updating a payment. Note that this instance of the transactions object accepts only the amount object.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getPayment
blocks.description: Shows details for a payment, by ID, that is yet completed. For example, a payment that was created, approved, or failed.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: paymentId
args.info: The ID of the payment to execute.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: updatePayment
blocks.description: Partially updates a payment, by ID. You cannot update a payment after the payment is executed.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: paymentId
args.info: The ID of the payment to execute.

args.name: items
args.info: A JSON patch object that you can use to apply partial updates to resources. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updatePayment README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getPaymentList
blocks.description: Lists payments that were created by the create payment call and are in any state. The list shows the payments that are made to the merchant who makes the call.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: count
args.info: The number of items to list in the response. Default: 10.

args.name: startId
args.info: The ID of the starting resource in the response. When results are paged, you can use the next_id value as the start_id to continue with the next set of results.

args.name: startIndex
args.info: The start index of the resources to return. Typically used to jump to a specific position in the resource history based on its cart. Example for starting at the second item in a list of results: ?start_index=2

args.name: startTime
args.info: The date and time when the resource was created. Indicates the start of a range of results. Example: start_time=2013-03-06T11:00:00Z Format: date-time.

args.name: endTime
args.info: The date and time when the resource was created. Indicates the end of a range of results. Format: date-time.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getSale
blocks.description: Shows details for a sale transaction, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: saleId
args.info: The ID of the sale for which to show details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: refundSale
blocks.description: Refunds a completed payment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: saleId
args.info: The ID of the sale for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. Refund details including both the refunded amount to payer and refunded fee to payee. If you do not provide an amount, you must still provide an empty JSON payload in the body to indicate a full refund. See the parameter notes section for more information. See refundSale README for more details.

args.name: invoiceNumber
args.info: The invoice number that is used to track this payment. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters. Maximum length: 127.

args.name: refundAdvice
args.info: Flag to indicate that the buyer was already given store credit for a given transaction.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getRefund
blocks.description: Shows details for a refund, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: refundId
args.info: The ID of the refund for which to show details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getAuthorization
blocks.description: Shows details for an authorization, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authorizationId
args.info: The ID of the authorization for which to show details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: captureAuthorization
blocks.description: Use this resource to capture and process a previously created authorization.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authorizationId
args.info: The ID of the authorization for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. The amount to capture. If the amount matches the orginally authorized amount, the state of the authorization changes to captured. If not, the state of the authorization changes to partially_captured. See the parameter notes section for more information. See captureAuthorization README for more details.

args.name: isFinalCapture
args.info: Indicates whether to release all remaining funds that the authorization holds in the funding instrument. Default is false. Default: false.

args.name: invoiceNumber
args.info: The invoice number to track this payment. Maximum length: 127.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: voidAuthorization
blocks.description: Voids a previously authorized payment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authorizationId
args.info: The ID of the authorization for which to show details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: reauthorizePayment
blocks.description: Reauthorizes a PayPal account payment. We recommend that you reauthorize a payment after the initial three-day honor period to ensure that funds are still available.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authorizationId
args.info: The ID of the authorization for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. Amount being reauthorized. See the parameter notes section for more information. See reauthorizePayment README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getCapture
blocks.description: Shows details for a captured payment, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: captureId
args.info: The ID of the captured payment for which to show details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: refundCapture
blocks.description: Refunds a captured payment, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: captureId
args.info: The ID of the captured payment for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. The amount to be refunded to the original payer by the payee. See the parameter notes section for more information. See refundCapture README for more details.

args.name: description
args.info: Description of what is being refunded for. Character length and limitations: 255 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

args.name: refundSource
args.info: Type of PayPal funding source (balance or eCheck) that can be used for auto refund. Allowed values: INSTANT_FUNDING_SOURCE, ECHECK, UNRESTRICTED. Default: UNRESTRICTED.

args.name: reason
args.info: Reason description for the Sale transaction being refunded.

args.name: invoiceNumber
args.info: The invoice number that is used to track this payment. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

args.name: refundAdvice
args.info: Flag to indicate that the buyer was already given store credit for a given transaction.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getOrder
blocks.description: Shows details for an order, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The ID of the order for which to show details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: authorizeOrder
blocks.description: Authorizes an order, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The ID of the order for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. Amount being collected. See the parameter notes section for more information. See authorizeOrder README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: captureOrder
blocks.description: Captures a payment on an order.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The ID of the order for which to show details.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. The amount to capture. If the amount matches the orginally authorized amount, the state of the authorization changes to captured. If not, the state of the authorization changes to partially_captured. See the parameter notes section for more information. See captureOrder README for more details.

args.name: isFinalCapture
args.info: Indicates whether to release all remaining funds that the authorization holds in the funding instrument. Default is false. Default: false.

args.name: invoiceNumber
args.info: The invoice number to track this payment.

args.name: transactionFee
args.info: Json object. The transaction fee for this payment. See the parameter notes section for more information. See captureOrder README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: voidOrder
blocks.description: Voids an order, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The ID of the order to void.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: createPlan
blocks.description: You can create an empty billing plan and add a trial period and/or regular billing. Alternatively, you can create a fully loaded plan that includes both a trial period and regular billing.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: name
args.info: The billing plan name.

args.name: description
args.info: The billing plan description.

args.name: type
args.info: The billing plan type. Allowed values: FIXED, INFINITE.

args.name: paymentDefinitions
args.info: Array of json objects. Resource that represents payment definition scheduling information. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createPlan README for more details.

args.name: merchantPreferences
args.info: Json object. Resource that represents the merchant preferences for a plan, such as max failed attempts, set up fee, and so on. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createPlan README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: updatePlan
blocks.description: You can update the information for an existing billing plan. The state of a plan must be active before a billing agreement is created.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the billing plan to update.

args.name: items
args.info: A JSON array patch object used for applying partial updates to resources. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updatePlan README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getPlan
blocks.description: Use this call to get details about a specific billing plan.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: planId
args.info: The ID of the billing plan to update.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getPlanList
blocks.description: Use this call to get a list of all billing plans based on their current state and optional query string parameters.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: page
args.info: The page to return. Default is 0.

args.name: status
args.info: The state. Default is CREATED. Possible values: created, active, inactive.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The maximum number of results to return at one time. A valid value is a non-negative, non-zero integer. Default is 10.

args.name: totalRequired
args.info: The total number of items and pages to return in the response.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: createAgreement
blocks.description: Creates a billing agreement for the buyer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: description
args.info: Description of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Start date of the agreement. Date format yyyy-MM-dd z, as defined in ISO8601. Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSTimeZone.

args.name: payer
args.info: Json object. A resource representing a Payer that funds a payment. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createAgreement README for more details.

args.name: plan
args.info: Json object. Billing plan resource that will be used to create a billing agreement. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createAgreement README for more details.

args.name: agreementDetails
args.info: Json object. A resource representing the agreement details. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createAgreement README for more details.

args.name: shippingAddress
args.info: Json object. Base Address object used as billing address in a payment or extended for Shipping Address. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createAgreement README for more details.

args.name: overrideChargeModels
args.info: Array of json objects. A resource representing an override_charge_model to be used during creation of the agreement. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createAgreement README for more details.

args.name: overrideMerchantPreferences
args.info: Json object. Resource representing merchant preferences like max failed attempts,set up fee and others for a plan. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createAgreement README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: executeAgreement
blocks.description: Executes an agreement after the buyer approves it.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: paymentToken
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to execute.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: updateAgreement
blocks.description: Updates an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to update.

args.name: items
args.info: Array of json objects. A JSON patch object used for applying partial updates to resources. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateAgreement README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getAgreement
blocks.description: Shows details for an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to retrieve.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: suspendAgreement
blocks.description: Suspends an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to suspend.

args.name: note
args.info: Reason for changing the state of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See suspendAgreement README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: reactivateAgreement
blocks.description: Reactivates an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to re-activate.

args.name: note
args.info: Reason for changing the state of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See reactivateAgreement README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: cancelAgreement
blocks.description: Cancels an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to cancel.

args.name: note
args.info: Reason for changing the state of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See cancelAgreement README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getTransactionsForBillingAgreement
blocks.description: Lists transactions for a billing agreement.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to cancel.

args.name: startDate
args.info: The start date of the range of transactions to list.

args.name: endDate
args.info: The end date of the range of transactions to list.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: setAgreementBalance
blocks.description: Sets the outstanding amount of an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to cancel.

args.name: currency
args.info: 3 letter currency code as defined by ISO 4217.

args.name: value
args.info: amount up to N digit after the decimals separator as defined in ISO 4217 for the appropriate currency code

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: billAgreementBalance
blocks.description: Bills the outstanding amount of an agreement, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: agreementId
args.info: Identifier of the agreement resource to cancel.

args.name: note
args.info: Reason for changing the state of the agreement. Maximum length: 128.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See billAgreementBalance README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: createPayout
blocks.description: You can make payouts to one or more PayPal accounts.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: senderBatchHeader
args.info: Json object. The sender-provided batch header for a batch payout request. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createPayout README for more details.

args.name: items
args.info: Array of json objects. A sender-created definition of a payout to a single recipient. Maximum length: 5000. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createPayout README for more details.

args.name: syncMode
args.info: Set to true to return an immediate and synchronous response. Default is false, which returns an asynchronous response in the background.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getPayout
blocks.description: Periodically shows the latest status of a batch payout along with the transaction status and other data for individual items.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: payoutBatchId
args.info: The ID of the batch payout for which to show status.

args.name: fields
args.info: Shows details for only specified fields.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getPayoutItem
blocks.description: Shows the details for a payout item. Use this call to review the current status of a previously unclaimed, or pending, payout item.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: payoutItemId
args.info: The ID of the payout item for which to show details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: cancelPayoutItem
blocks.description: Cancels an unclaimed transaction. If no one claims the unclaimed item within 30 days, the funds are automatically returned to the sender. Use this call to cancel the unclaimed item before the automatic 30-day refund.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: payoutItemId
args.info: The ID of the payout item for which to show details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: createCreditCard
blocks.description: Stores credit card details with PayPal.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: number
args.info: Credit card number. Valid value is numeric characters with no spaces or punctuation. The string must conform with modulo and length required by each credit card type.

args.name: type
args.info: Credit card type. Allowed values: visa, mastercard, amex, discover, maestro.

args.name: expireMonth
args.info: Expiration month with no leading zero.

args.name: expireYear
args.info: The 4-digit card expiry year.

args.name: cvv2
args.info: The 3 to 4 digit card validation code.

args.name: firstName
args.info: The first name of the card holder. Maximum length is 25 characters.

args.name: lastName
args.info: The last name of the card holder.

args.name: billingAddress
args.info: Json object. Base Address object used as billing address in a payment or extended for Shipping Address. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createCreditCard README for more details.

args.name: externalCustomerId
args.info: Externally provided ID of the customer for which to list credit card resources.

args.name: merchantId
args.info: ID of the merchant for which to list credit card resources.

args.name: payerId
args.info: unique ID that you can assign and track when you store a credit card or use a stored credit card.

args.name: externalCardId
args.info: Externally provided ID of the card for which to list credit card resources.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: deleteCreditCard
blocks.description: Deletes details of a stored credit card. Include the credit card ID in the request URI.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: creditCardId
args.info: The ID of the credit card resource for which to show data.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getCreditCard
blocks.description: Shows details for a stored credit card.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: creditCardId
args.info: The ID of the credit card resource for which to show data.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getCreditCardList
blocks.description: Lists stored credit cards.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The number of resources to list, starting with the specified page. Default: 10.

args.name: page
args.info: The number of pages to get. Default: 1.

args.name: startTime
args.info: The date and time when the resource was created in ISO8601 date-time format that indicates the start of a range of results. For example, 2013-11-05T13:15:30Z.

args.name: endTime
args.info: The date and time when the resource was created in ISO8601 date-time format that indicates the end of a range of results. For example, 2014-11-05T13:15:30Z.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Sorts the response in ascending or descending order. Value is asc for ascending order or desc for descending order. Default: desc.

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Sorts the response by create_time or update_time. Default: create_time.

args.name: merchantId
args.info: A user-provided, optional field that functions as a unique identifier for the merchant holding the card. Note that this has no relation to PayPal merchant ID.

args.name: externalCardId
args.info: A unique identifier of the bank account resource. Generated and provided by the facilitator to use to restrict the usage of the bank account to the specific merchant.

args.name: externalCustomerId
args.info: Externally provided customer identifier to filter the search results in list operations.

args.name: totalRequired
args.info: Indicates whether the response returns the total_items and total_pages values. Default is true. Set to false to omit these values from the response.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: updateCreditCard
blocks.description: Updates a stored credit card, by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: creditCardId
args.info: The ID of the credit card resource to update.

args.name: items
args.info: Array of json objects. A JSON patch object used for applying partial updates to resources. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateCreditCard README for more details.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: createTokenFromAurhorizationCode
blocks.description: Updates a stored credit card, by ID.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client id.

args.name: secret
args.info: secret

args.name: grantType
args.info: Token grant type. Value must be set to authorization_code.

args.name: code
args.info: Authorization code previously received from the authorization server.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: Application return URL where the authorization code is sent.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: createTokenFromRefreshToken
blocks.description: Create an access token from a refresh token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client id.

args.name: secret
args.info: secret

args.name: grantType
args.info: Token grant type. Value must be set to authorization_code.

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: Refresh token previously received along with the access token that is to be refreshed.

args.name: scope
args.info: Resource URL endpoints that the client wants the token to be scoped for. The value of the scope parameter is expressed as a list of space-delimited, case-sensitive strings.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getUser
blocks.description: Use this call to retrieve user profile attributes.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: schema
args.info: the schema that is used to return as per openidconnect protocol. Possible values: openid.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: createInvoice
blocks.description: Creates a draft invoice.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: merchantInfo
args.info: Json object. Merchant business information that appears on the invoice. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: number
args.info: The unique invoice number. If you omit this number, it is auto-incremented from the previous invoice number. Maximum length: 25.

args.name: templateId
args.info: The ID of the template from which to create the invoice. Useful for copy functionality.

args.name: billingInfo
args.info: Array of json objects. Billing information for the invoice recipient. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: ccInfo
args.info: Array of json objects. Participant information. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: shippingInfo
args.info: Json object. Shipping information for the invoice recipient. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: items
args.info: Array of json objects. Line item information. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: invoiceDate
args.info: The date when the invoice was enabled. The date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: paymentTerm
args.info: Json object. The payment term of the invoice. If you specify term_type, you cannot specify due_date, and vice versa. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: reference
args.info: Reference data, such as PO number, to add to the invoice. Maximum length: 60.

args.name: discount
args.info: Json object. The cost as a percent or an amount value. For example, to specify 10%, enter 10. Alternatively, to specify an amount of 5, enter 5. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: shippingCost
args.info: Json object. Shipping cost, as a percent or an amount value. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: custom
args.info: Json object. The custom amount to apply to an invoice. If you include a label, you must include a custom amount. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: allowPartialPayment
args.info: Indicates whether the invoice allows a partial payment. If false, invoice must be paid in full. If true, the invoice allows partial payments. Default is false.

args.name: minimumAmountDue
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See createInvoice README for more details.

args.name: taxCalculatedAfterDiscount
args.info: Indicates whether the tax is calculated before or after a discount. If false, the tax is calculated before a discount. If true, the tax is calculated after a discount. Default is false.

args.name: taxInclusive
args.info: Indicates whether the unit price includes tax. Default is false.

args.name: terms
args.info: The general terms of the invoice. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: note
args.info: A note to the payer. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: merchantMemo
args.info: A private bookkeeping memo for the merchant. Maximum length: 150.

args.name: logoUrl
args.info: The full URL to an external logo image. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: attachments
args.info: The array of files attached to an invoice or template.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: sendInvoice
blocks.description: Sends an invoice, by ID, to a customer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: The ID of the invoice to send.

args.name: notifyMerchant
args.info: Indicates whether to send the invoice update notification to the merchant. Default is true.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

args.name: notifyMerchant

args.name: number
args.info: The unique invoice number. If you omit this number, it is auto-incremented from the previous invoice number. Maximum length: 25.

args.name: templateId

args.name: billingInfo
args.info: Array of json objects. Billing information for the invoice recipient. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateInvoice README for more details.

args.name: items
args.info: Array of json objects. Line item information. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateInvoice README for more details.

args.name: invoiceDate
args.info: The date when the invoice was enabled. The date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: paymentTerm
args.info: Json object. The payment term of the invoice. If you specify term_type, you cannot specify due_date, and vice versa. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateInvoice README for more details.

args.name: reference

args.info: Json object. The cost as a percent or an amount value. For example, to specify 10%, enter 10. Alternatively, to specify an amount of 5, enter 5. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateInvoice README for more details.

args.name: shippingCost
args.info: Json object. Shipping cost, as a percent or an amount value. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateInvoice README for more details.

args.name: custom
args.info: Json object. The custom amount to apply to an invoice. If you include a label, you must include a custom amount. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateInvoice README for more details.

args.name: allowPartialPayment
args.info: Indicates whether the invoice allows a partial payment. If false, invoice must be paid in full. If true, the invoice allows partial payments. Default is false.

args.name: minimumAmountDue
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateInvoice README for more details.

args.name: taxCalculatedAfterDiscount
args.info: Indicates whether the tax is calculated before or after a discount. If false, the tax is calculated before a discount. If true, the tax is calculated after a discount. Default is false.

args.name: taxInclusive
args.info: Indicates whether the unit price includes tax. Default is false.

args.name: terms
args.info: The general terms of the invoice. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: note
args.info: A note to the payer. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: merchantMemo
args.info: A private bookkeeping memo for the merchant. Maximum length: 150.

args.name: logoUrl
args.info: The full URL to an external logo image. Maximum length: 4000.

args.name: attachments
args.info: The array of files attached to an invoice or template.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: getInvoiceList
blocks.description: Lists invoices that belong to the merchant who makes the call.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: page
args.info: A zero-relative index of the list of merchant invoices. Default: 1.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The number of invoices to list beginning with the specified page. Default: 10.

args.name: totalCountRequired
args.info: Indicates whether the total count appears in the response. Default is false.

args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: generateInvoiceNumber
blocks.description: Generates the next invoice number that is available to the user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: searchInvoice
blocks.description: Lists invoices that match search criteria.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: email
args.info: The initial letters of the email address.

args.name: recipientFirstName
args.info: The initial letters of the recipient first name.

args.name: recipientLastName
args.info: The initial letters of the recipient last name.

args.name: recipientBusinessName
args.info: The initial letters of the recipient business name.

args.name: number
args.info: The invoice number.

args.name: status
args.info: The invoice status. Allowed values: DRAFT, SENT, PAID, MARKED_AS_PAID, CANCELLED, REFUNDED, PARTIALLY_REFUNDED, MARKED_AS_REFUNDED.

args.name: lowerTotalAmount
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See searchInvoice README for more details.

args.name: upperTotalAmount
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See searchInvoice README for more details.

args.name: startInvoiceDate
args.info: The start date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: endInvoiceDate
args.info: The end date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: startDueDate
args.info: The start due date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: endDueDate
args.info: The end due date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: startPaymentDate
args.info: The start payment date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: endPaymentDate
args.info: The end payment date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: startCreationDate
args.info: The start creation date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: endCreationDate
args.info: The end creation date for the invoice. Date format is yyyy-MM-dd z.

args.name: page
args.info: The offset for the search results.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The page size for the search results.

args.name: totalCountRequired
args.info: Indicates whether the total count appears in the response. Default is false.

args.name: archived
args.info: Indicates whether to list merchant-archived invoices in the response. If true, response lists only merchant-archived invoices. If false, response lists only unarchived invoices. If null, response lists all invoices.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: The ID of the invoice.

args.name: subject

args.name: ccEmails

args.name: width
args.info: The width, in pixels, of the QR code image. Valid value is from 150 to 500. Default is 500.

args.name: height
args.info: The height, in pixels, of the QR code image. Valid value is from 150 to 500. Default is 500.

args.name: action
args.info: The type of URL for which to generate a QR code. Default is pay and is the only supported value.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The number of webhook event notifications to return in the response. Default: 10.

args.name: startTime
args.info: Filters the webhook event notifications in the response to those created on or after this date and time and on or before the endTime value.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Filters the webhook event notifications in the response to those created on or after the startTime and on or before this date and time.

args.name: transactionId
args.info: Filters the response to a single transaction, by ID.

args.name: eventType
args.info: Filters the response to a single event.

blocks.name: cancelSentInvoice
blocks.description: Cancels a sent invoice, by ID, and, optionally, sends a notification about the cancellation to the payer, merchant, and Cc: emails.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: invoiceId
args.info: The ID of the invoice to cancel.

args.name: subject
args.info: The subject of the notification.

args.name: note
args.info: A note to the payer.

args.name: sendToMerchant
args.info: Indicates whether to send the notification to the merchant.

args.name: sendToPayer
args.info: Indicates whether to send the notification to the payer.

args.name: ccEmails
args.info: An array of one or more Cc: emails. If you omit this parameter from the JSON request body, a notification is sent to all Cc: email addresses that are part of the invoice. Otherwise, specify this parameter to limit the email addresses to which a notification is sent. See the parameter notes section for more information. See cancelSentInvoice README for more details.

args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

args.name: date
args.info: The date when the invoice was paid. The date format is yyyy-MM-dd z

args.name: note
args.info: A note associated with the payment.

args.name: amount
args.info: Json object. Base object for all financial value related fields (balance, payment due, etc.). See the parameter notes section for more information. See markInvoiceAsPaid README for more details.

args.name: amount

blocks.name: createTemplate
blocks.description: Creates an invoice template. When you create an invoice from a template, the invoice is populated with the predefined data that the source template contains.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: name
args.info: The template name.

args.name: default
args.info: Indicates whether this template is the default merchant template. A merchant can have one default template. True or false

args.name: templateData
args.info: Json object. Detailed template information. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createTemplate README for more details.

args.name: settings
args.info: Array of json object. Template settings. See the parameter notes section for more information. See createTemplate README for more details.

args.name: unitOfMeasure
args.info: The unit of measure for the template. Value is quantity, hours, or amount.

args.name: sandbox

args.name: templateId
args.info: The ID of the template to delete.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: verifyWebhookSignature
blocks.description: Verifies a webhook signature.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: authAlgo
args.info: The algorithm that PayPal uses to generate the signature and that you can use to verify the signature. Extract this value from the PAYPAL-AUTH-ALGO response header, which is received with the webhook notification.

args.name: certUrl
args.info: The X.509 public key certificate. Download the certificate from this URL and use it to verify the signature. Extract this value from the PAYPAL-CERT-URL response header, which is received with the webhook notification.

args.name: transmissionId
args.info: The ID of the HTTP transmission. Contained in the PAYPAL-TRANSMISSION-ID header of the notification message.

args.name: transmissionSig
args.info: The PayPal-generated asymmetric signature. Extract this value from the PAYPAL-TRANSMISSION-SIG response header, which is received with the webhook notification.

args.name: transmissionTime
args.info: The date and time of the HTTP transmission. Contained in the PAYPAL-TRANSMISSION-TIME header of the notification message.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: The ID of the webhook as configured in your Developer Portal account.

args.name: webhookEvent
args.info: A webhook event notification.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.

blocks.name: updateTemplate
blocks.description: Updates a template, by ID. In the JSON request body, pass a complete template object. The update method does not support partial updates.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: accessToken obtained with clientId and secret.

args.name: templateId
args.info: The ID of the template to update.

args.name: name
args.info: The template name.

args.name: default
args.info: Indicates whether this template is the default merchant template. A merchant can have one default template. True or false

args.name: templateData
args.info: Json object. Detailed template information. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateTemplate README for more details.

args.name: settings
args.info: Array of json objects. Template settings. See the parameter notes section for more information. See updateTemplate README for more details.

args.name: unitOfMeasure
args.info: The unit of measure for the template. Value is quantity, hours, or amount.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Use sandbox to tests. Set 1 to enable.
